data.title: Family go to restaurant
data.text: We've been coming to Crouching Tiger since they opened. My son has been here so much that the wait staff recognizes him more than they do his parents. Everyone is very polite and if you're a regular, or regular enough, they treat you with warmth. We like the scallion pancakes, the walnut prawns, the kung pao shrimp or pork, the war wonton soup and my husband loves the cashew chicken.

data.title: Good fast food
data.text: The entrance doesn't afford a view of the restaurant, so one has to walk several steps in to be seen by the host.  When I did, they welcomed me in and seated me.  I noticed every table in the place had an Asian family seated.  The food was delivered quickly and was hot and delicious. I ate here twice during the week.  I had kung pao chicken once and the dry cooked pork once.  The dry cooked pork is billed as one of their house special dishes and is a little spicy.  Dry cooked pork is my stronger recommendation, but I doubt you can go wrong with a choice here.

data.title: Yummy food!
data.text: Very good food, reasonable prices, fast service and everything is fresh! No wait on a Thursday night!

data.title: Food is very authentic
data.text: On weekends it could be very crowded. Service is unfortunately not very attentive or friendly. But their food is really good. Great variety.

data.title: Good food, reasonable
data.text: We like to come here with co-workers because the menu has something that appeals to everyone, and we eat family-style. The food is mostly "Americanized" Chinese food, although they do have some unusual dishes like braised pork knuckles. Service is sometimes hit or miss during lunch but overall the food is fairly consistent.

data.title: Good food but salty
data.text: The sweet & sour soup was good, they brought it to us as soon as we sat down. I had snow peas with beef, which I hadn't had before. It was good, had snow peas, sliced carrots and water chestnuts. However it was very salty. I was with a couple, and the wife told me her dish was salty too. Maybe because it's Hunan, I'm not sure. The service was very good and staff was pleasant. Just be prepared for salty food.

data.title: Great food and atmosphere!
data.text: This restaurant offers a very good selection of food choices.  I've eaten here many times and they have something for everyone including vegans.  It's been a little while since I have been there but they have consistency in their food and great service also.  Tasty food.  Food that tastes healthy as well.  Their meats are tender and you can't go wrong eating here.

data.title: Authentic food, great prices! Service and neatness could improve..
data.text: The day we had dinner at The Crouching Tiger they had a private party on the second part of tge restautant, so I'm not sure if it was because of this but our service was really slow, when we arrived no one greeted us, we found ourselves a table, and it took them a good 10-15 minutes to notice us and clean tbe table. Once we placed our order the food started coming around 15-20 minutes later, but it was so good that it was worth the wait. Best won-ton soup ever! We ordered a two-people menu so we got several dishes for a great price. The portions were very generous and we had to take some leftovers back to the hotel. I would definitely come back, hopefully no private parties will distract the staff from the regular customers and offer better service.

data.title: Great Chinese Food in Redwood City
data.text:
My family and I have been looking for good Chinese food in the area, but had not yet found the right place, until we went to Crouching Tiger.  We made a reservation for 6:00 on Friday and were glad we did, as the place got really crowded with people waiting for tables.  We were seated promptly before the big rush.

The menu is very large, with traditional favorites.  The food is well prepared and plentiful.  We had potstickers, chicken and broccoli,tomato beef, white rice, and green tea..and lots of fortune cookies!.  Everything was excellent, some of the best we have ever had.  My wife said the tomato beef was the best she ever had.  My two children, ages 3 and 9, also loved the food, especially the potstickers.

The service is good and the staff friendly.  Our bill, including 4 glasses of plum wine and tip, was about $80.  So reasonable prices.  We will DEFINITELY go back and highly recommend it.

data.title: Food and locale were good, but service is chaotic
data.text: We came here for dinner on a rainy Friday night. The place is packed with customers from a private party on one side and other regular customers like us on the other side. There was complete anarchy on the part of the management. The person behind the cashier do not pay any attention not attempt to have a wait list for the customers. Even though we have reservation, it is free-to-grab a table. We have to wave down a waitress to let her know that we have reservation. The service was very slow, we helped our self to the menu. The only savior was the food that were very good and authentic. It is a place we may give another shot.

data.title: A Little different menu
data.text: you can find many different dishes to try, as well as the normal Chinese plates. A wee bit noisy at times, when there is a full house. But worth the noise.

data.title: The Best Chinese Food in the Area!
data.text:
My coworkers and I have dined here many times for lunch, and loved the food, service, decor and ambiance every single time. We were looking for great Chinese cuisine, and when we saw that Crouching Tiger was highly rated on both the Zagat and the Michelin restaurant guides, we knew we should try it. That was several years ago, and we love having lunch there. 

Some of us (me included) tend to order the same dishes each time because they have become our favorites, while others have tried most everything on the menu. Whether you dine in or order to take out, the food is really delicious! My favorites are the Prawns Chow Fun and Vegetables Chow Fun but I'm sure you'll soon find your own favorites.

Parking can be an issue because Crouching Tiger is located in downtown Redwood City, so we usually go around 11:30 am or 1:00 pm to avoid the noon lunch rush. There is street parking on Broadway, and also a triangular-shaped parking lot behind the restaurant (you pay at a kiosk using your parking space number and take a ticket) - the lot is directly across the street from the Caltrain station.

data.title: Simply gopd
data.text: The service is a bit "special" but food is amazing. We really like it. Spicy. Juicy. Fresh. Crunchy. The dumplings are great and portions are huge. Chicken sezuan is my favorite.

data.title: Superb food
data.text: The food was very good. We liked their hot and sour soup. The small complementary turnip pickle was delicious (I guess it not be to everyone's liking, though). I'd go back to the place again. Parking on the street is free after 6pm.

data.title: Excellent Chinese Food and Gluten Free Menu
data.text: Crouching Tiger is a very attractive restaurant on Broadway in Redwood City with easy parking.  Their spices and sauces are unique and the food tastes as if a great deal of thought went into their menu.  I had just eaten there once when I found out I had Celiac and had to give up gluten. On a whim I called them and sure enough, they can make nearly every dish gluten free. Oh, I was so happy to hear this.  I've been back there twice since then and the GF good tastes just as delicious as my previous meal.  Prices are extremely reasonable for this high quality food in a very attractive restaurant.

data.title: Good Chinese food, doesn't deliver
data.text: Used to be better, but still has very good Chinese food - the best in the area. Would be better if they delivered.

data.title: A group dinner - boy it was great
data.text: We belong to a group called ACCT (Association of Chinese Cooking Teachers) that has turned into a social eating group. We are not Asian but you couldn't tell by the smiles on our faces. A group of about 70 of use had a 14 course dinner tonight. Each dish was the some of the finest that we have eaten. Chicken, shrimp, lamb, pork, soup, noodles and moon cakes one after another just to name some. Each dish was a joy. Will be going back very soon, well as soon as my diet permits.

data.title: Pay attention to your customers, they are paying attention to YOU!
data.text: I used to really like this place. The last few times have been ok. Last night we tried to order some take out. We were told to go to a counter where we watched a few employees fighting about some take out orders. After being uncomfortable watching the ongoing battle, we tried again to order from a waitress who pointed us to the fighting counter employees. We walked out and no one seemed to care.

data.title: A plethora of vegetarian options makes this a winning destination for me
data.text: Delicious food with tons of vegetarian and fake-meat options.  Hot and sour soup was both hot and sour, and the presence of white pepper and vinegar on the table made it even more so.  We only stopped in for lunch so didn't get to sample more than a couple of dishes, but what we had was fresh and wonderfully flavored.  I'm always on the lookout for great veggie-friendly places when traveling to Redwood Shores for work, and I'll definitely be back next time I'm in the area.

data.title: Sichuan?
data.text: Had the dry-fried chicken. Nicely spicy, but... No sichuan peppercorns in evidence. Fried jalapeno included. A credible imitation, but not really Chongqing style.
